formattedAddress: 170 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 170 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text: The complex is fine. It appears secure, and the location is excellent. However, the space is overpriced given its square footage and condition. Nevertheless, Angel from leasing was an absolute pleasure. She is one of the most modest and charming leasing agents I've ever encountered. She is also incredibly knowledgeable.

text.text: The complex is fine. It appears secure, and the location is excellent. However, the space is overpriced given its square footage and condition. Nevertheless, Angel from leasing was an absolute pleasure. She is one of the most modest and charming leasing agents I've ever encountered. She is also incredibly knowledgeable.

originalText.text: My husband and I have lived at 170 Amsterdam for 1 1/2 years.  Our apartment, the building, and the neighborhood felt like home within days of moving in. When our lease was up after the first year, we immediately re-upped for 2 more years.    The building has just the right amenities for us.  We especially enjoy the rooftop terrace and the music practice rooms. We love our apartment.  It has everything we need - modern layout, floor-to-ceiling windows, and a fabulous view.  But the best part has definitely been the people who work here.  Sophia (the community manager), Andres and the concierge staff, and every single person who works here really goes above and beyond to help whenever we need something.  Their positive attitudes and can-do spirit really make this a great place to live.

originalText.text: Honestly the best place to live in the UWS! I spent 2 years here thanks to the building's fantastic community manager Sophia Kocevar. The staff is amazing with 24 hour concierge, making the building feel safe & easy to receive packages. Everyone is so nice (Andres, Walter, Jose, Eduardo, Edison...too many to name!). It's also really great that if something needs to be repaired, the maintenance team comes right away. The apartments are kept up very well (modern & new), the rooftop is amazing, and it's only a short walk to Central Park and Trader Joes.

originalText.text: My husband and I are so grateful to call this place home with our two small pups. Sophia and her entire Team have become “family” and everyone from the front desk to the building workers are wonderful. We couldn’t be happier.

text.text: My husband and I are so grateful to call this place home with our two small pups. Sophia and her entire Team have become “family” and everyone from the front desk to the building workers are wonderful. We couldn’t be happier.

originalText.text:
I’ve lived in the building for over four years
Concierge and the maintenance are wonderful
Equity residential is a different story
They are in the middle of construction now and I live on the first floor
The two bedrooms and the living room kitchen area are all floor to ceiling glass
Initially they boarded it up with plywood and felt this was acceptable until people started to complain and then they replaced it with plexiglass with plywood planks
Equity residential does not really want to give anybody on the first floor anything but a very minimal
Amount of money
We cannot use the outside area at all and for me I have no privacy as workmen walk back-and-forth all day long
And I can still see them through the shades
I have to get dressed in the morning in the bathroom
They have commandeered our laundry room
They are sawing  and doing work right outside my bedroom window not on my area of the building but doing work for other parts of the complex without regard to my privacy
They will not give me any kind of a date when the work will be finished nor will they give me any money but a  token amount of money to make up for my loss of privacy filthy windows workman walking back in front of my apartment all day long, etc.
And loss of use of my outdoor space
I pay over $7000 a month in rent and I’m treated very poorly
Equity residential has shown Little interest in treating the residents  with any respect
Apparently they have no person in charge of watching these workmen and after many many requests that they don’t leave garbage in front of my windows or work product in front of my windows I have to constantly send notes because nobody watches them
The community manager is a 25-year-old young lady with absolutely no experience in dealing with these situations
They have in fact indicated that I have no right to privacy etc
The way I have been treated is appalling.
I would not recommend this building nor  with equity residential or any of their buildings
